snippet: Washington State’s Supreme Court ruled that a voter-approved referendum requiring a two-thirds vote in the Legislature for tax changes was unconstitutional.
abstract: Washington State's Supreme Court rules that voter-approved referendum restricting Legislature's ability to raise taxes is unconstitutional.
lead_paragraph: Washington State’s Supreme Court ruled that a voter-approved referendum requiring a two-thirds vote in the Legislature for tax changes was unconstitutional.

headline.seo: Tax Law Is Struck Down in Washington State
headline.main: Washington State’s Top Court Strikes Down Law on Taxes
headline.print_headline: Washington State’s Top Court Strikes Down Law on Taxes
